name: Botrytis cinerea (Gray Mold)
summary: Botrytis cinerea, commonly known as Gray Mold, is a fungal disease that affects a wide range of plants, particularly in humid and damp conditions. It is characterized by grayish-brown fuzzy growth on infected plant parts, leading to rot and decay.

cause_of_disease.describe: Gray Mold thrives in high humidity conditions, which promote the growth and spread of the Botrytis cinerea fungus.
Lack of air movement around plants can create an ideal environment for the fungus to develop.
The fungus can survive on plant debris left in the garden, acting as a reservoir for new infections.

steps: Space plants adequately to ensure proper airflow.
Water plants in the morning to allow foliage to dry during the day.
Use fans or ventilation systems in greenhouses to reduce humidity.
Apply appropriate fungicides as per local guidelines.
Repeat treatments as necessary during high-risk periods.

tips: Regularly remove and destroy any affected plant material.
Avoid overhead watering to minimize leaf wetness.
Choose resistant plant varieties when available.
